concept.title: Archiving of Local Data to Nearline Storage

conbody.p: You can archive the local data in a table to Nearline storage with the archivetbl subcommand of the atmanage utility. You can archive the entire table, or you can limit the archiving to a specific time frame. You will need to run this command every time you want to archive data. You may want to write a script that calculates the maximum and minimum timestamp parameters required by the command, and then schedule that script to run on a regular schedule using a scheduling utility such as the Linux cron utility.
